page.title: 01Kyle of Tongue Sutherland
page.content: This area covers the northern part of the Kyle of Tongue and includes the Causeway which links the parishes of Tongue and Melness. The main buildings are Tongue House owned by the Countess of Sutherland, and St Andrews Church of Scotland dating from 1690. There is a small supermarket with petrol pumps, garage and calor gas supplies.The Youth Hostel is situated at the east end of the causeway and isopen for six months during summer. Onthe Thurso road there is the old school building now a weaving and craft shop and snack bar. When the ride goes out much of the Kyle is uncovered and seals can be seen basking on the sandbanks just north of the causeway. There is one farm in the area, the rest of the land is mainly moorland.
